titleStmt.title: A. G. Roberts et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1874

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p: Your petitioners would Reppresent that they labor under grate inconvienance on account of having no Justice of the peace in their district that they live in Dis No 3 of Shelby County known as the Christainburgh Dis that one of there Justices of the peace to wit J C Stedman moved to the county of Henry thereby locating his office & Cary White the other has died we therefor Ask you to appoint two sutible men for said office & we sujest the name of Henry Bohannon & John S Farmer

John W. Eakins
C. C. Sacrey
Peter Vardeman
T. J. Montgomery
Az Montgomery
P. B. Broddly
H Cordiman for Bohannon
Thos D Johnson
Jas S Vardiman
T. M. Johnson
Wm Vardeman
J. B. Rudford
Stephen Marten
J. S. Baskett
R. H. Dodson
W. C. Harkette
T. Vardiman
Samuel Poter
A G Roberts states that the statement contained in the within pet are true
Sworn to before me by A G Roberts this 23d day of May 1864

Henry Bohannon Esr
for Shelby County.

Secty of State
Enquire as to this of Hon Z Wheat

Shelby Co
Justices Peace
Henry Bohannon & Jas S. Baskett
apptd
31st May/64
